text:
Q: QtWidgets not loading the resources when run A:

Turns out my CMake file is missing

set(CMAKE_AUTORCC ON)

When I added it, images loaded fine.

Searched for one hour before posting and didn't stumble upon this but somehow found the answer just 2 minutes after asking here.

Q: An error occurred while preparing SDK package NDK (Side by side) 29.0.14206865: Not in GZIP format A:

Answer

The error:

An error occurred while preparing SDK package Android Emulator: Not in GZIP format

means that Android Studio downloaded a corrupted emulator archive:

emulator-darwin_aarch64-xxxxxxx.zip

This usually happens on macOS (M1/M2/M3) when the SDK Manager stores an incomplete download in its cache.

✅ Solution

You need to delete the corrupted files from the SDK cache and let Android Studio download them again.

1. Open your Android SDK directory

In my case the SDK path was:

/Users/USERNAME/Library/Android/sdk

You can check yours in:

Android Studio → Settings → Appearance & Behavior → System Settings → Android SDK
(Path is shown at the top.)

2. Delete cached downloads

Remove everything inside these two folders:

~/Library/Android/sdk/temp/
~/Library/Android/sdk/.cache/

If .cache is hidden, reveal hidden files in Finder with:

Command + Shift + .

Or via terminal:

rm -rf ~/Library/Android/sdk/temp/*
rm -rf ~/Library/Android/sdk/.cache/*

3. Reinstall the Android Emulator

Open:

Android Studio → Settings → Android SDK → SDK Tools

Disable Android Emulator → Apply
Then enable Android Emulator → Apply again.

Or install via terminal:

cd ~/Library/Android/sdk/cmdline-tools/latest/bin
./sdkmanager --install "emulator"

Q: Technique to measure GPU utilization over a given period of time A:

You can use dcgmi to get job statistics

#Enable statstics for GPU group - do this once
dcgmi stats -g <GPU group> --enable
#Start recording statistics for a job
dcgmi stats -g <GPU group> -s <user-provided-jobid>

#Start the actual job/process/work on the GPU

#At job end stop recording
dcgmi stats -x <user-provided-jobid>
#Export statistics for job and remove them to free memory
dcgmi stats -j <user-provided-jobid> -v -r <job id> > $LOGFILE
#Disable system watchers when no longer relevant
dcgmi stats -g <GPU group> --disable

Q: DB2 Fetch First 1 ROWS ONLY for each parameter of IN Clause A:

You can use a VALUES clause as a virtual table and join laterally with it.

SELECT
  COALESCE(mt.A_ID, mt.B_ID)
FROM (VALUES ('ID_1'), ('ID_2') ) AS v(Id)
CROSS JOIN LATERAL (
    SELECT
      mt.A_ID,
      mt.B_ID
    FROM MY_TABLE AS mt
    WHERE v.Id IN (mt.A_ID, mt.B_ID)
    ORDER BY someColumnHere
    FETCH FIRST 1 ROWS ONLY
) AS mt

For large lists you can use a window function

SELECT
  COALESCE(mt.A_ID, mt.B_ID)
FROM (
    SELECT
      mt.*,
      ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY COALESCE(mt.A_ID, mt.B_ID) ORDER BY someColumnHere) AS rn
    FROM MY_TABLE AS mt
    WHERE mt.A_ID IN ('ID_1', 'ID_2')
      OR mt.B_ID IN ('ID_1', 'ID_2')
) AS mt
WHERE mt.rn = 1;
